xml.brief: Retrieve information on a single cacheset log entry

desc.p: Retrieve information on a single cacheset log entry.

opt.name: fields
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested with. Selected fields will be included in the response. See below fot the list of available fields.

returns.p: A dictionary of fields you have selected. Currently available fields:

ul.li: uuid - unique ID of the log entry,
cacheset_uuid - ID of the cacheset which the log entry refers to,

li.p: date - date and time (ISO 8601) when the log entry was submitted.

ul.li: uuid - ID of the user (author of the log entry),
profile_url - URL of the profile page of the user,

li.p: type - string; log type. One of the values documented below.

ul.li: "Has completed" - a user has completed the cacheset.

li.p: Types which indicate a change of state of the geocache or confirm the state at the given time (used only by some Opencaching installations):

ul.li: "Temporarily unavailable" - log of this type indicates that the status of the cacheset was changed to "Temporarily unavailable" at that time, or it was confirmed as "Temporarily unavailable". Most probably the cacheset was not available to be found at that time, but it was expected to be repaired soon (and then, "Ready to search" log type would be submitted).

"Ready to search" - log of this type indicates that the status of this cacheset was changed back to "Available", or it was confirmed as "Available". After some period of not being available the cacheset became ready to be found again.

"Archived" - log of this type indicates that the status of this cacheset was changed to "Archived" at this point in time. This usually means that the cache could not be found anymore at this time, and it was not expected to be repaired any time soon.

li.p: Other types (used only by some Opencaching installations):

ul.li: "OC Team comment" - a comment made by the official OC Team member.
(to be continued) - this list MAY expand in time! Your application should accept unknown log types (you may treat them as "Comment"s).
comment - HTML string, text entered with the log entry,

returns.p: Note, that some fields can change in time (users can edit/delete their log entries).
If given log entry does not exist, the method will respond with an HTTP 400 error.
